meanings.definition: A person who talks loudly and boastfully.
meanings.sent1: The loudmouths in the cafeteria were bragging about their grades.
meanings.sent2: The loudmouths at the party dominated the conversation with their stories.
meanings.sent3: The loudmouths in the library were shushed by the librarian for being too noisy.
meanings.sent4: The loudmouths in the office were like blaring sirens, impossible to ignore.
meanings.sent5: The image of the loudmouths shouting at the top of their lungs stayed with me.

meanings.definition: A group of people who are loud and talkative.
meanings.sent1: The loudmouths in the park were laughing and chatting loudly.
meanings.sent2: The loudmouths in the classroom made it hard to concentrate on the lesson.
meanings.sent3: The loudmouths at the zoo were so noisy, they scared the animals.
meanings.sent4: The loudmouths in the stadium created a wall of sound that echoed through the stands.
meanings.sent5: The memory of the loudmouths chattering away lingered in my mind.
